author: 1MISSINGNO1

text:
Everything about this game rang "Ah...the good ol' days!" I loved it so much that I actually refused to beat it because I hate it when good things come to an end. It's been years now since I've last played it.
Amazing graphics. Epic cinematic scenes. Beautiful music. Action packed and dramatic story. Sad, heart tugging stories of Kaim's past.
I'm definitely going to play it again and beat it this time.
author: Manna

text: Isn't he ^^ I really am so glad Nobou left Square Enix to start his own music company, to create music for all sorts of games. Yes thankfully he does still create music for Square Enix, though not so much lately it seems, but Nobou's music in Lost Odyssey is some of the best music I've ever had the pleasure of hearing, not just exclusive to gaming
author: Lunar Blossom

text: I couldn't agree more. I also didn't realize until I played this how much I missed out on the classic battle system, I never got to play a game with a battle style like this before. Even so this was completely different. The stunning graphics during each battle, yet keeping it classic, but having new and improved features. But the story and characters is what makes this among my favorite games, the gameplay really was a huge bonus I wasn't expecting
author: Lunar Blossom

text: I miss classic battle system, and I'm sure there are many of us.

text: Lost Odyssey is far from a masterpiece of the RPG genre, and even the soundtrack isn't terribly memorable (by Uematsu's standards anyway)... and yet, I can't help loving it. author: SmokeMyBlunt

text:
The words on the gravestone were chosen by Greo himself.

He explained his choice to Kaim this way: "I would say the words to each new pair of shoes before I handed them to the customer. I always said them to the customer, too. I never once had the experience, though, of someone saying the words to me."

"May your journey be a good one!"

These were the words the old man always spoke. Coming from his mouth they could be brusque, but they were always charged with feeling.
